actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.

official_title: Resolution creating a select committee to conduct an investigation and study of tourism in the United States.

summary.text: Establishes a select committee of the House to be composed of nine Members of the House of Representatives. Authorizes the committee to conduct a full and complete investigation and study to determine a policy and role for the United States with respect to tourism in the United States which will most effectively enable the industry to realize fully its potential to contribute to an understanding of American culture and to the economic prosperity of the United States. Directs the Committee to report to the House as soon as practicable during the present Congress the results of its investigation and study, together with such recommendations as it deems advisable.

titles.title: Resolution creating a select committee to conduct an investigation and study of tourism in the United States.
